channel.title: Ipod to Iphone
channel.description:
Should I buy a Ipod or Iphone...
Question 1: Would I be able to use my Iphone as an Ipod if I dont have it activated as an phone?
Question 2: Whats the difference?

item.title: Ipod to Iphone
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Not to mention it should get software updates faster because its straight from google :o

Read full topic

item.title: Ipod to Iphone
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

ziplock:

Nexus 4 would be so awesome. The only thing about the phone that worries me is that it’s manufactured by LG…

Idk, I have scored a benchmark Nexus 4 and S3
and nexus came close to a 2200 and S3 came around a 1500 on geekbench (CPU bench)
and Idk, sometimes the nexus seemed sluggish when visiting webpages, but supposedly the hardware is supposedly far superior than S3
Exynos clocked at 1.6ghz vs 1.3ghz (i think)
quadcore vs dual core (us carrier)
But anyhow I would pick nexus 4, because you get direct access to a new android OS when a new one comes out.
S3 isn’t as fast. S voice is dirt. But it feels liquid fast when you swipe and visit webpages.
I like Iphone, I have used it for 2 years now, Im using nexus 4 now though. I think I will be switching back to Iphone when my contract ends

Read full topic

item.title: Ipod to Iphone
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:44, topic:426491”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=529186.msg4202737#msg4202737 date=1358457730]
What provider are you? My phone broke 4 times in as many months (same intermittent fault) and they gave me the S2 but I had to pay
[/quote]
Verizon

Serious question, what would you guys recommend Galaxy S3 (or another Android phone) or the iPhone 5?

Nah mate, Nexus 4 is leading, would kill for one of those, sucks I’m stuck on my contract for the next year

How long have you been on the current contract? Depending on the carrier, if you’ve had it long enough for them to recoup their money on the phone and want to sign up for another contract they have no problem doing so.

Since November 2011, I’ve looked it up though and it was something like 200 quid for termination…

That is how long I’ve been on mine and they let me start again last month. The termination fee is still in the contract, but they might waive it if you’re going to commit again[/quote]
I suppose it depends on the provider and possibly even the retail cost of the handset, but you’re in US so it might even be completely different, I’m with O2 here in England

Read full topic

item.title: Ipod to Iphone
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

the elve age:

Serious question, what would you guys recommend Galaxy S3 (or another Android phone) or the iPhone 5?

I’d say the Galaxy S3, although I’ve never used either of the two phones. My friend got the iPhone 5 the day it came out and had it for about a month, then he switched to the Galaxy S3 (spoiled kid, he gets whatever he wants) and still has the Galaxy S3. He said he prefers it over the iPhone 5.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Java_, post:17, topic:426491”][quote author=Java_ link=topic=529186.msg3861086#msg3861086 date=1324677856]
I went there and they were all out of Ipod’s so I was going to buy a Ipad but an Acer laptop cost the same so I said love it and bought the Acer Laptop since I only have a desktop.
[/quote][/quote]
I recommend that you take the laptop back as soon as possible (if you can even return it and get your cash back). Acer is probably one of the worst commercial computers you can buy.

Read full topic

item.title: Ipod to Iphone
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Java_, post:1, topic:426491”]Should I buy a Ipod or Iphone…

Question 1: Would I be able to use my Iphone as an Ipod if I dont have it activated as an phone?

Question 2: Whats the difference?[/quote]

The difference is purely that an iPhone is basically and iPod with calling, texting, and other phone-like features. However, if you get an unlocked iPhone, it can provide the functions a normal iPod would. There may be some differentiating between the hardware, depending on what generation of iPod/iPhone you’re debating on.

Read full topic

item.title: Ipod to Iphone

Bb10.
Move along people.

Nice battery life there bro
[/quote]

It’s rumoured to be fairly decent, the battery life. Of course we’ve only had the dev phones to mess around with but it all looks promising.

Oh my little friend, I have a soft spot for you.[/quote]

What?! Blackberry are releasing a phone with a battery that lasts longer than 10 minutes? This is a good day.

Awh, us trees have to stick together.
